intro: Hieracium caesium subsp. leucodaedalum, commonly known as the white-veined hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its daisy-like yellow flowers with white veins. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are erect and often branched. It is a perennial herb that produces small, wind-pollinated flowers, contributing to its role in supporting pollinators.
